  • INDIA'S GAUTAM ADANI: ASIA'S RICHEST MAN WEATHERING STOCK MARKET PANIC

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/business/gautam-adani-india-tycoon-stock-market-corporate-fraud-allegations-hindenburg-3236291

    01/28/2023

    83.78% Shortened!

    Shares in the business empire of Asia's richest man Gautam Adani nosedived after a US investment firm claimed it had committed "brazen" corporate fraud

    Indian billionaire Gautam Adani addresses delegates during the Bengal Global Business Summit in Kolkata, India on Apr 20, 2022

    Adani was born in Ahmedabad to a middle-class family but dropped out of school at 16 and moved to the financial capital Mumbai to find work in the lucrative gems trade

    Adani is seen as an acolyte of Hindu nationalist Prime Minister Narendra Modi, a fellow Gujarat native, and has aligned his own business interests with those of "nation building"

    Adani batted away press freedom fears, but told the Financial Times that journalists should have the "courage" to say "when the government is doing the right thing every day"

    The issues now facing Adani's empire "strike at the heart" of India's corporate sector and the dominance of family-controlled firms, Global CIO Office chief executive Gary Dugan told Bloomberg on Friday

    ['business', 'adani', 'corporate', 'india', 'year']

    Shares in the business empire of Asia's richest man Gautam Adani nosedived after a US investment firm claimed it had committed "brazen" corporate fraud

    Indian billionaire Gautam Adani addresses delegates during the Bengal Global Business Summit in Kolkata, India on Apr 20, 2022

    Adani was born in Ahmedabad to a middle-class family but dropped out of school at 16 and moved to the financial capital Mumbai to find work in the lucrative gems trade

    Adani is seen as an acolyte of Hindu nationalist Prime Minister Narendra Modi, a fellow Gujarat native, and has aligned his own business interests with those of "nation building"

    Adani batted away press freedom fears, but told the Financial Times that journalists should have the "courage" to say "when the government is doing the right thing every day"

    The issues now facing Adani's empire "strike at the heart" of India's corporate sector and the dominance of family-controlled firms, Global CIO Office chief executive Gary Dugan told Bloomberg on Friday

  • BANDAR KUCHING MP URGES STATE GOVT TO RECONSIDER PLAN TO ERECT COUNTRY'S HIGHEST FLAGPOLE

    https://www.theborneopost.com/2023/01/28/bandar-kuching-mp-urges-state-govt-to-reconsider-plan-to-erect-countrys-highest-flagpole/

    01/28/2023

    57.14% Shortened!

    According to Dr Yii, the best way to honour the return of Sarawak’s rights under MA63 is to ensure that such rights translate into direct benefit for the people of Sarawak

    “But with ‘great power, comes great responsibility’

    Additional autonomy or even allocations should be vetted and scrutinised with utmost diligence and the Sarawak Government has the onus and greater responsibility to ensure its being spent prudently, without wastage, and more importantly benefiting the people of Sarawak,” he said

    Dr Yii stressed that there are greater needs that can be invested in Sarawak especially when it comes to healthcare and even in education

    Yesterday, a source told The Borneo Post that the Sarawak government was planning to erect the country’s highest flagpole to fly the Sarawak flag in Petra Jaya

    The source said the proposed flagpole would be 99 metres tall, four metres higher than the country’s current tallest flagpole at Merdeka Square in Kuala Lumpur

    ['yii', 'government', 'erect', 'flagpole', 'sarawak']

  • US POLICE OFFICERS SEEN PUNCHING, KICKING TYRE NICHOLS AFTER MEMPHIS RELEASES FOOTAGE OF DEADLY BEATING

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/world/us-tyre-nichols-police-beating-death-memphis-video-released-3237871

    01/28/2023, 09:07

    86.05% Shortened!

    Tyre Nichols, a 29-year-old black man who was pulled over while driving and died three days later, is detained by Memphis Police Department officers on Jan 7, 2023, in this screengrab from a video released by Memphis Police Department

    A separate video shows a subsequent struggle after officers catch up with Nichols again, and are beating him

    The officers, all black, had already been dismissed from the police department last Saturday following their Jan 7 confrontation with Nichols after pulling him over

    Civil rights attorney Ben Crump, representing Nichols' family, said the last words on the video were Nichols crying out for his mother

    Antonio Romanucci, another lawyer for Nichols' family, told National Public Radio in an interview on Friday that Nichols was a strong supporter of the Black Lives Matter movement and "basically died for his own cause"

    Police have described the circumstances of Nichols' arrest in vague terms

    ['nichols', 'black', 'memphis', 'police', 'department']

  • VIDEO SHOWS MEMPHIS POLICE OFFICERS KICKING, BEATING TYRE NICHOLS

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/world/us-tyre-nichols-police-beating-death-memphis-video-released-3237871

    01/28/2023, 09:07

    86.67% Shortened!

    Tyre Nichols, a 29-year-old black man who was pulled over while driving and died three days later, is detained by Memphis Police Department officers on Jan 7, 2023, in this screengrab from a video released by Memphis Police Department

    The officers, all black, were dismissed from the police department last week

    The beatings appeared to continue far beyond a point where Nichols could pose any threat to police

    Nichols is heard repeatedly screaming, "Mom! Mom!" as he struggles with officers

    Memphis police chief Cerelyn Davis said before the video's release that it showed behaviours on the part of police officers "that defy humanity"

    Nichols' family and Biden appealed for calm in Memphis, a city of 628,000 where nearly 65 per cent of residents are black

    ['nichols', 'memphis', 'police', 'officer', 'video']

    Nichols is heard repeatedly screaming, "Mom! Mom!" as he struggles with officers

    Memphis police chief Cerelyn Davis said before the video's release that it showed behaviours on the part of police officers "that defy humanity"

  • LOCALS FEAR LOSING THEIR JOBS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/01/28/locals-fear-losing-their-jobs

    01/28/2023, 09:07

    75.0% Shortened!

    Workers of factories in the northern states claim their job contracts would not be continued as foreign workers would be brought in to replace them

    A source told The Star that there were employers who would offer longer contract periods to foreign workers – up to five years – while locals are only offered six months

    Many of them will be out of a job next month,” said the source, a factory supplier based in Penang

    Sivakumar announced that 500,000 foreign workers are gradually being brought into the country via the Foreign Workers Employment Relaxation Plan, which aims to address the shortage of manpower

    She said any such move would be unfair to local workers as they would have to look for new jobs amid the economic uncertainty

    She said Pusma would raise the matter with the Human Resources Ministry

    Mohammad Rizan said the issue must be studied to ensure local workers, especially the youth, would have a place in the labour force

    ['worker', 'employer', 'would', 'foreign', 'local']

    Workers of factories in the northern states claim their job contracts would not be continued as foreign workers would be brought in to replace them

    A source told The Star that there were employers who would offer longer contract periods to foreign workers – up to five years – while locals are only offered six months

    Many of them will be out of a job next month,” said the source, a factory supplier based in Penang

    Sivakumar announced that 500,000 foreign workers are gradually being brought into the country via the Foreign Workers Employment Relaxation Plan, which aims to address the shortage of manpower

    She said any such move would be unfair to local workers as they would have to look for new jobs amid the economic uncertainty

    She said Pusma would raise the matter with the Human Resources Ministry

    Mohammad Rizan said the issue must be studied to ensure local workers, especially the youth, would have a place in the labour force

    ['worker', 'employer', 'would', 'foreign', 'local']

    01/28/2023, 08:09

    53.85% Shortened!

    Walking out of the party supreme council meeting held at Menara Dato’ Onn, he told reporters that Umno president Datuk Seri Ahmad Zahid Hamidi has since agreed to his request to be expelled from the party

    He also insisted that his suspension did not follow procedure, as his meeting with the party’s disciplinary board was due to be held on Monday

    He pointed to Article 8.1 of the party constitution, saying that the Umno general assembly is the highest level of power in the party, but that its authority is restricted by the constitution and party rules

    Besides that, he raised the question of who the real traitor within the party is, saying he had then refused to back Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim following the party's decision to reject any cooperation with the Pakatan Harapan (PH) chairman and DAP

    “If the party has made a decision, why should we go against it? So whoever goes against the party’s decision, then he is the one who is the real traitor to the party

    The Umno supreme council is meeting tonight, which among others will decide dates for the party’s internal polls and the fates of some that were deemed saboteurs.

    “The allocation of low-cost housing units were according to the percentage stipulated in the structure plan where 55 per cent is for Bumiputera, 30 per cent for Chinese and others and 15 per cent for Indians,” he said when contacted

    He added that for low and medium-cost units, 35 per cent goes to Bumiputera, 50 per cent to the ethnic Chinese and others, and 15 per cent to the ethnic Indians

    Jagdeep, the state exco for housing and local government, said those who manipulated the issue of housing Penang to score political points should first look at their facts

    Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia’s Datuk Wan Saiful Wan Jan recently accused the state government of adopting a public housing scheme to change the demography of the island

    He alleged that due to the DAP-led state government’s housing policy, the percentage of property ownership among Malays in the state has remained low at only 27 per cent while 55 per cent of properties in Penang are owned by the ethnic Chinese

    “The question now is what is the link between the bringing in of Singaporean housing experts with property ownership in Penang that Wan Saiful brought up?” he asked

    ['penang', 'government', 'housing', 'state', 'say']

    Friday was Auckland’s wettest day on record, with heavy rain triggering a state of emergency in the city of about 1.6 million people.   Emergency workers and a man wade through floodwaters in Auckland, New Zealand on Jan 27, 2023

    Hipkins said Auckland experienced "its wettest day on record" on Friday

    Showers were "dotted around Auckland" with some heavy west of the city, Auckland Emergency Management tweeted, while warning residents to "stay safe" amid the emergency

    The flash flooding on Friday quickly turned many of Auckland's roads into rivers

    Most of the flood water had subsided by Saturday afternoon, but Hipkins warned that further rain is forecast and advised Auckland residents to stay home

    "We want to get Auckland back up and running as quickly as possible," Hipkins added.

    ['auckland', 'heavy', 'rain', 'emergency', 'city']

  • HOLIDAY TRIPS WITHIN CHINA SURGE AFTER LIFTING OF COVID-19 CURBS

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/covid-19-china-chinese-new-year-travel-lifted-curbs-domestic-trips-3238076

    01/28/2023

    64.71% Shortened!

    An estimated 226 million domestic trips were made by all means including plane during the Chinese New Year holiday week.  People walk with their luggage at a railway station during the annual Spring Festival travel rush ahead of Chinese New Year, in Shanghai, China on Jan 16, 2023

    Chinese New Year is the most important holiday of the year in China, when huge numbers of people working in prosperous coastal cities head to their hometowns and villages for family reunions

    That compares with about 130 million domestic trips during the holiday week last year, according to the transport ministry

    In the last Chinese New Year holiday before the novel coronavirus emerged in late 2019 in the central city of Wuhan, about 420 million trips were made internally

    As for travel abroad, inbound and outbound cross-border trips jumped 120.5 per cent from last year to 2.88 million, the National Immigration Administration said on Saturday

    During the Chinese New Year holiday in 2019, 12.53 million cross-border trips were made, the Xinhua news agency reported

    ['million', 'trip', 'chinese', 'new', 'year']

    An estimated 226 million domestic trips were made by all means including plane during the Chinese New Year holiday week.  People walk with their luggage at a railway station during the annual Spring Festival travel rush ahead of Chinese New Year, in Shanghai, China on Jan 16, 2023

    Chinese New Year is the most important holiday of the year in China, when huge numbers of people working in prosperous coastal cities head to their hometowns and villages for family reunions

    That compares with about 130 million domestic trips during the holiday week last year, according to the transport ministry

    In the last Chinese New Year holiday before the novel coronavirus emerged in late 2019 in the central city of Wuhan, about 420 million trips were made internally

    As for travel abroad, inbound and outbound cross-border trips jumped 120.5 per cent from last year to 2.88 million, the National Immigration Administration said on Saturday

    During the Chinese New Year holiday in 2019, 12.53 million cross-border trips were made, the Xinhua news agency reported

    ['million', 'trip', 'chinese', 'new', 'year']

    Even when Sadio was there, he was dropping in moments, and that is not Darwin’s game

    It is all good if they would all be in and we could build something, but we couldn’t do that

    You have to go through it

    We can lose a game and we did that and if you don’t learn from it, it is just a defeat

  • HOW MUCH DO I REALLY NEED TO RETIRE? FIDELITY WANTS YOU TO SAVE 10 TIMES YOUR INCOME BY AGE 67. BUT HERE ARE 3 REASONS WHY THAT COULD BE DEAD WRONG

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/much-really-retire-fidelity-wants-140000364.html

    76.0% Shortened!

    What may be surprising, however, is that a popular recent answer to that retirement amount question — Fidelity Investments’ counsel to sock away 10 times your current annual income by age 67 — may be one of the most misleading pieces of advice on the retirement web

    But some financial experts believe Fidelity’s 10 times guidance undershoots the real cost of retirement

    Not only would that leave you exposed, it could undermine the feeling of financial independence we all want in retirement

    Consider Fidelity’s own 2022 guidance that a retiring 65-year-old American couple can expect to spend $315,000 on medical and health expenses in retirement, a 5% jump over 2021

    Using a retirement calculator, a 53-year-old making $100,000 a year, with $500,000 in their 401(k) and who plans to retire at 67, would have to save at least $3,300 a month — or nearly 40% of their income — to reach a nest egg of about $1.6 million

    It’s also possible your needs, and costs, may diminish in retirement

    ['guidance', 'much', 'retirement', 'time', 'health']

    What may be surprising, however, is that a popular recent answer to that retirement amount question — Fidelity Investments’ counsel to sock away 10 times your current annual income by age 67 — may be one of the most misleading pieces of advice on the retirement web

    But some financial experts believe Fidelity’s 10 times guidance undershoots the real cost of retirement

    Not only would that leave you exposed, it could undermine the feeling of financial independence we all want in retirement

    Consider Fidelity’s own 2022 guidance that a retiring 65-year-old American couple can expect to spend $315,000 on medical and health expenses in retirement, a 5% jump over 2021

    Using a retirement calculator, a 53-year-old making $100,000 a year, with $500,000 in their 401(k) and who plans to retire at 67, would have to save at least $3,300 a month — or nearly 40% of their income — to reach a nest egg of about $1.6 million

    It’s also possible your needs, and costs, may diminish in retirement

    ['guidance', 'much', 'retirement', 'time', 'health']



  • ASK AN ADVISOR: WE ARE 70 YEARS OLD, HAVE $99K IN RETIREMENT INCOME, A $1.4M IRA AND OTHER INVESTMENTS. IS IT TOO LATE TO CONVERT TO A ROTH?

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/ask-advisor-70-years-old-202905223.html

    89.09% Shortened!

    Our Roth is worth $400,000

    There is no age cap on your ability to convert to a Roth

    There is also no earned income requirement to convert to a Roth

    A financial advisor may help you understand how to manage the tax repercussions of a Roth conversion

    Roth conversions make the most sense when you can choose to pay the income tax on your IRA balance and move it to a Roth in a relatively low-income tax year

    Other Tax Implications Federal income tax gets all the attention when Roth conversions come up

    ['income', 'ira', 'roth', 'convert', 'conversion']

  • CONGRESS TO VOTE ON WHETHER TO ABOLISH THE IRS AND INTRODUCE ONE NATIONAL TAX RATE

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/congress-vote-whether-abolish-irs-163355705.html

    91.78% Shortened!

    tax code is very straightforward

    As written, the Fair Tax Act is misleading

    As a result, while the Fair Tax Act as written proposes a 23% inclusive tax, it would be a 30% tax in the way that virtually all taxpayers calculate sales taxes

    One study from 2011 found that the results of a 30% sales tax, as proposed under the Fair Tax Act, would shift the nation's tax burden overwhelmingly

    Virtually all tax experts to study the issue agree that it would complicate the tax code and act as a massive tax cut for the wealthy

    Tips on Taxes The Fair Tax Act proposes a sweeping new sales tax

    ['would', 'fair', 'tax', 'act', 'income']

  • USA TO HOST 16-TEAM 2024 COPA AMERICA WITH 6 CONCACAF TEAMS

    https://www.espn.co.uk/football/copa-america/story/4862467/united-states-likely-to-host-2024-copa-america-after-advanced-talks-sources

    01/28/2023

    71.43% Shortened!

    For women's national teams, CONCACAF has invited the top four CONMEBOL national teams to participate in the 2024 CONCACAF W Gold Cup

    The inaugural edition of this 12-team tournament will also be played in the United States

    The two CONCACAF teams that will participate in the 2024 Summer Olympics (United States and Jamaica or Canada) will qualify directly for the 2024 CONCACAF W Gold Cup

    The remaining six CONCACAF teams will be determined through the 2023 Road to CONCACAF W Gold Cup

    Argentina is the defending Copa America and World Cup champion

    "CONMEBOL and Concacaf are united by historical and affective ties," CONMEBOL president Alejandro Dominguez said in a statement

    ['cup', 'copa', 'america', 'united', 'conmebol']

    "CONMEBOL and Concacaf are united by historical and affective ties," CONMEBOL president Alejandro Dominguez said in a statement

  • AFRICAN SWINE FLU: 23 PENANG PIG FARMS HIT

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/01/28/african-swine-flu-23-penang-pig-farms-hit

    01/28/2023

    64.71% Shortened!

    Saturday, 28 Jan 2023

    He said as of Friday (Jan 27), a total of 7,998 pigs from six farms in Seberang Perai Tengah (SPT) and Seberang Perai Selatan (SPS) have been culled after they were found to be ASF positive

    "All the pig carcasses were buried in the SPS area which are far from public settlements or at undeveloped locations, so as not to cause disturbance in the areas involved

    "Last week the ASF threat was stable

    He said currently there were 124 pig farms in Penang with a total of 267,348 pigs

    "To date, 101 pig farms have not been hit with the ASF disease where 35 of the farms are in SPS with a total of 97,104 animals, 60 farms in SPU (100,600 animals), two farms in SPT (5,539 animals) and four farms in Barat Daya (10,830 animals)," he said

    ['pig', 'farm', 'penang', 'asf', 'say']

    Saturday, 28 Jan 2023

  • NO NEED TO DECLARE FLOOD EMERGENCY IN MALAYSIA, SAYS DPM AHMAD ZAHID

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/malaysia-flood-johor-sabah-pahang-ahmad-zahid-relief-centre-3238506

    01/28/2023

    53.85% Shortened!

    The states of Johor, Pahang and Sabah have been hit by flooding amid heavy rain brought about by the northeast monsoon

    Resident Jamaluddin Kamal assessing the flood damage to his home in Johor, Malaysia

    The states of Johor, Pahang and Sabah have been hit by flooding amid continuous heavy rain brought about by the northeast monsoon.  Nearly 14,000 people in the three states were in temporary flood relief centres, Bernama reported on Saturday morning, but that number fell significantly by evening.  “I don’t think a flood emergency should be declared because it only involves certain states and districts

    The state disaster management committees have taken proactive measures together with the district disaster management committees,” said Ahmad Zahid, who is also the chairman of the Central Disaster Management Committee

    “The aid provided has been given to all the heads of families and, at the same time, we have other matters that need to be carried out, including post-flood assistance,” he told a media conference after visiting a temporary relief centre in Mersing.  Ahmad Zahid, who is also the rural and regional development minister, added that the government will look into improving coordination among non-governmental organisations (NGOs) and the relevant agencies involved in post-flood management

    When asked to comment on political developments a day after his party UMNO expelled former health minister Khairy Jamaluddin and suspended former defence minister Hishammuddin Hussein, Ahmad Zahid, who is party president, said he would only address flood-related questions.  “This is a press conference on flood matters only," he said, as quoted by the Star.  UMNO (United Malays National Organisation), Malaysia’s oldest political party, expelled Khairy and supreme council member Noh Omar on Friday for breaching party disciplinary rules during the country’s recent general election

    ['state', 'flood', 'say', 'ahmad', 'zahid']

    The states of Johor, Pahang and Sabah have been hit by flooding amid heavy rain brought about by the northeast monsoon

    The state disaster management committees have taken proactive measures together with the district disaster management committees,” said Ahmad Zahid, who is also the chairman of the Central Disaster Management Committee

    When asked to comment on political developments a day after his party UMNO expelled former health minister Khairy Jamaluddin and suspended former defence minister Hishammuddin Hussein, Ahmad Zahid, who is party president, said he would only address flood-related questions.  “This is a press conference on flood matters only," he said, as quoted by the Star.  UMNO (United Malays National Organisation), Malaysia’s oldest political party, expelled Khairy and supreme council member Noh Omar on Friday for breaching party disciplinary rules during the country’s recent general election

    Interest from West Ham in defender Harry Maguire has been rebuffed and Ten Hag has insisted the United captain remains an important player

    To do this we will link your MailOnline account with your Facebook account

    We’ll ask you to confirm this for your first post to Facebook

    You can choose on each post whether you would like it to be posted to Facebook

    ['comment', 'ten', 'hag', 'mailonline', 'post']

    Galtier has now clarified that Kimpembe and Mbappe are both vice-captains

    We have a captain and four vice-captains who are Kimpembe, Marco [Verratti], Kylian and Sergio [Ramos]

    When Marquinhos is not there for some reason, choice, injury or suspension, there is another captain

    "During the match in Lens, there was no Kimpembe, there was no Marco

  • FTX FOUNDER BANKMAN-FRIED OBJECTS TO TIGHTER BAIL, SAYS PROSECUTORS 'SANDBAGGED' HIM

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/business/ftx-founder-bankman-fried-objects-tighter-bail-says-prosecutors-sandbagged-him-3238636

    01/28/2023

    68.42% Shortened!

    Former FTX Chief Executive Sam Bankman-Fried, who faces fraud charges over the collapse of the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange, leaves on the day of a hearing at Manhattan federal court in New York City, US on Jan 3, 2023

    Bankman-Fried, 30, has been free on a US$250 million bond since pleading not guilty to charges of fraud in the looting of billions of dollars from the now-bankrupt FTX

    Prosecutors said their request was in response to Bankman-Fried's recent effort to contact a potential witness against him, the general counsel of an FTX affiliate, and was needed to prevent witness tampering and other obstruction of justice

    They said a Signal ban isn't necessary because Bankman-Fried is not using the auto-delete feature, and the concern that he might is "unfounded"

    The lawyers also asked to remove a bail condition preventing Bankman-Fried from accessing FTX, Alameda or cryptocurrency assets, saying there was "no evidence" he was responsible for earlier alleged unauthorised transactions

    In an order on Saturday, Kaplan gave prosecutors until Monday to address Bankman-Fried's concerns

    ['ftx', 'bankman', 'fry', 'lawyer', 'say']

    Former FTX Chief Executive Sam Bankman-Fried, who faces fraud charges over the collapse of the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange, leaves on the day of a hearing at Manhattan federal court in New York City, US on Jan 3, 2023

    Bankman-Fried, 30, has been free on a US$250 million bond since pleading not guilty to charges of fraud in the looting of billions of dollars from the now-bankrupt FTX

    Prosecutors said their request was in response to Bankman-Fried's recent effort to contact a potential witness against him, the general counsel of an FTX affiliate, and was needed to prevent witness tampering and other obstruction of justice

    They said a Signal ban isn't necessary because Bankman-Fried is not using the auto-delete feature, and the concern that he might is "unfounded"

    The lawyers also asked to remove a bail condition preventing Bankman-Fried from accessing FTX, Alameda or cryptocurrency assets, saying there was "no evidence" he was responsible for earlier alleged unauthorised transactions

    In an order on Saturday, Kaplan gave prosecutors until Monday to address Bankman-Fried's concerns

  • BURSA LIKELY TO STAGE REBOUND IN COMING WEEK, SAY DEALERS

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/node/653261

    01/28/2023

    50.0% Shortened!

    On a week-on-week basis, the key index eased 2.78 points to 1,497.55 on Friday (Jan 27), against 1,500.33 a week earlier

    On the index board, the FBM Emas Index rose 50.88 points to 10.893.36, the FBM Emas Shariah Index gained 83.93 points to 11,177.55, and the FBMT 100 Index added 30.13 points to 10,563.91.  Meanwhile, the FBM ACE Index increased 175.15 points to 5,731.23, and the FBM 70 Index advanced 253.19 points to 13,759.84

    Sector-wise, the Industrial Products and Services Index inched up 2.41 points to 190.77, the Energy Index bagged 34.95 points to 880.76, and the Technology Index improved 0.89 point to 68.29

    Weekly turnover fell to 11.21 billion units worth RM6.12 billion, against 14.28 billion units worth RM9.63 billion last week

    The Main Market volume shrank to 7.23 billion shares valued at RM4.95 billion, from 8.87 billion shares valued at RM7.42 billion a week ago

    The ACE Market volume declined to 3.02 billion shares worth RM1.04 billion, from 3.88 billion shares worth RM1.91 billion last week.  We deliver news to your inbox daily Copyright © 1999-2023 The Edge Communications Sdn

    ['week', 'index', 'market', 'point', 'billion']

    On a week-on-week basis, the key index eased 2.78 points to 1,497.55 on Friday (Jan 27), against 1,500.33 a week earlier

    On the index board, the FBM Emas Index rose 50.88 points to 10.893.36, the FBM Emas Shariah Index gained 83.93 points to 11,177.55, and the FBMT 100 Index added 30.13 points to 10,563.91.  Meanwhile, the FBM ACE Index increased 175.15 points to 5,731.23, and the FBM 70 Index advanced 253.19 points to 13,759.84

    Sector-wise, the Industrial Products and Services Index inched up 2.41 points to 190.77, the Energy Index bagged 34.95 points to 880.76, and the Technology Index improved 0.89 point to 68.29

    Weekly turnover fell to 11.21 billion units worth RM6.12 billion, against 14.28 billion units worth RM9.63 billion last week

    The Main Market volume shrank to 7.23 billion shares valued at RM4.95 billion, from 8.87 billion shares valued at RM7.42 billion a week ago

    The ACE Market volume declined to 3.02 billion shares worth RM1.04 billion, from 3.88 billion shares worth RM1.91 billion last week.  We deliver news to your inbox daily Copyright © 1999-2023 The Edge Communications Sdn

    ['week', 'index', 'market', 'point', 'billion']

  • MINISTRY SCRUTINISES SICK, ABANDONED HOUSING PROJECTS TO PROTECT BUYERS’ RIGHTS, SAYS NGA

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/01/28/ministry-scrutinises-sick-abandoned-housing-projects-to-protect-buyers-rights-says-nga/52328

    01/28/2023

    45.45% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise IPOH, Jan 28 — The Ministry of Local Government Development (KPKT) will scrutinise every sick and abandoned housing project nationwide, to ensure the welfare and rights of buyers are protected

    Nga, who is also the Kepayang assemblyman, said the Kepayang Ipoh Residency, which consists of 252 apartment units, is one of the sick projects that has been successfully revived and completed; it is also equipped with facilities such as a multi-purpose hall, kindergarten, surau, nursery and playground

    He said apart from Kepayang Residency, PR1MA also has 10 other projects in Perak, including Falim Residency, Kampung Paloh Residency, Meru Residency, and Bandar Baru Setia Awan Perdana Residency

    “In the first 100 days, KPKT aims to complete nearly 5,000 units of affordable housing, including this residency, and several in other states

    He said through agencies under KPKT to date, there are more than 90 affordable housing projects, covering 40,000 housing units, in Perak

    Earlier, there was also the signing of documents of understanding between PR1MA and Koperasi Co-opbank Pertama Malaysia Berhad (Co-opbank Pertama) for the CBP MyPR1MA Housing scheme, which provides home financing of up to 110 per cent, with a rate as low as 3.85 per cent, for property priced between RM 250,000 to RM 500,000 per unit

    ['kpkt', 'housing', 'project', 'say', 'residency']

  • TRANSPORT MINISTER: LRT STATIONS CLOSED DUE TO SAFETY, NOW WAITING FOR EXPERTS' REPORT

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/01/28/transport-minister-lrt-stations-closed-due-to-safety-now-waiting-for-experts-report/52321

    01/28/2023

    62.5% Shortened!

    He said the Bandaraya and Masjid Jamek stations were shut down yesterday as a safety feature and would only be temporary

    Most importantly, for us, we must prioritise safety

    He also advised commuters on the Ampang LRT line to plan for alternative transport for next Monday at least

    Yesterday, national news agency Bernama reported delays in the services of the Ampang LRT line, due to structural damage to the flyover in Bandaraya LRT station area which was reportedly believed to be caused by nearby construction works

    The railway operator apologised for the inconvenience and announced free shuttle bus services as an alternative transport service for affected passengers

    In the latest update this morning on its official Facebook page, Rapid KL said the free shuttle bus services will operate at a frequency of between 10 to 15 minutes, with 10 buses on the LRT 9 route from Hang Tuah station to Bandaraya and nine buses on the LRT 10 route from the Masjid Jamek station to Bandaraya

    ['lrt', 'service', 'station', 'say', 'safety']

  • RAFIZI SAYS TARGETED SUBSIDY MECHANISM WILL IMPROVE MALAYSIA’S FISCAL POSITION

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/01/28/rafizi-says-targeted-subsidy-mechanism-will-improve-malaysias-fiscal-position/52245

    01/28/2023

    53.85% Shortened!

    Besides fiscal consolidation, Rafizi said, another challenge for the country is to broaden its revenue base

    “Broadening the base is no longer an option

    The third challenge, Rafizi said, is restructuring the economy, which means moving from a low wage-based, manufacturing-driven economy to one that is service-based with high tech and value content

    “It is more about our ability to provide the right skilled workforce, because we are no longer a low-value, low-wage manufacturing base

    “We have to restructure the economy in terms of digitisation

    We can unlock one or two per cent Gross Domestic Product growth if we close our digitisation gap, not just in the economy but especially in government services, which hopefully will lead to higher efficiency and more savings,” he added

    ['subsidy', 'country', 'fiscal', 'say', 'economy']

    “We have to restructure the economy in terms of digitisation

    He added the school administration was under a lot of pressure to ensure all the SPM students passed in their examinations

    “The PTA hopes to engage with the parent who had lodged the complaint on Sunday

    Asked about the funding for the two-day programme at a hotel here, Nasution said that 20% was from the PTA while 80% was from the school, parents and sponsors

    The issue was first highlighted on social media and it went viral about the school allegedly organising an SPM workshop only for Muslim students

    The school held a two-day, one-night SPM workshop for only Muslim students at a hotel, saying that it will only involve religious-related subjects

  • ELON MUSK SAYS HIS BIGGEST TESLA COMPETITION WILL BE A CHINESE AUTOMAKER: ‘THEY WORK THE SMARTEST’

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/elon-musk-says-biggest-tesla-215602992.html

    76.92% Shortened!

    The company’s shares have fallen 50% over the past year after a meteoric rise in 2020 and 2021, nestling in at a two-year low in November of last year

    But when pressed on the state of the electric vehicle industry in China, where Tesla has lost ground in the past year, Musk conceded that Chinese companies are the most likely to challenge Tesla’s dominance

    “We have a lot of respect for the car companies in China

    Demand for EVs in China is huge; a record 6 million electric cars were sold in China last year, accounting for over a quarter of new vehicle sales, and Chinese electric car companies are rising to meet demand

    Chinese carmaker BYD, which is backed by Warren Buffett, raced past Tesla in electric car sales in China last year

    The box-size Mini EV developed by Chinese company Wuling cost just over $5,000 last year, and in 2021 it ranked as the best-selling electric car in China

    ['tesla', 'car', 'china', 'year', 'company']

  • AFTER PROTESTING AT SWEDISH EMBASSY IN KL, ISLAMIST GROUP HEADS OVER TO DUTCH EMBASSY FOR APOLOGY OVER TORN QURAN

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/01/27/after-protesting-at-swedish-embassy-in-kl-islamist-group-heads-over-to-dutch-embassy-for-apology-over-torn-quran/52165

    01/27/2023, 17:15

    50.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Jan 27 — The Malaysian chapter of a pro-caliphate group Hizbur Tahrir mounted its second demonstration outside the Embassy of the Netherlands here after Friday prayers this afternoon, protesting the desecration of a Quran by a Dutch political leader earlier this week

    Some 80 members of the group, including children, had earlier held a peaceful protest outside the Swedish Embassy on Jalan Mayang Sari this morning, to condemn the burning of a Quran by Swedish-Danish politician Rasmus Paludan who leads a Danish party called Stram Kurs (which means Hard Line) outside the Turkish Embassy in Stockholm last week

    He claimed Oskam had “apologised” on behalf of the Netherlands government

    “But for us, the one who did it must apologise and the Netherlands government itself must apologise to all Muslims because the one who did it said his action was allowed by the government,” he told the demonstrators after meeting the Dutch representatives

    Mu’adz also claimed that Muslim leaders did not do enough to give a “stern warning” over Wagensveld’s action

    More than 50 policemen in uniform and plain clothes were observed watching the demonstration outside the Dutch Embassy

    ['outside', 'embassy', 'netherlands', 'protest', 'dutch']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Jan 27 — The Malaysian chapter of a pro-caliphate group Hizbur Tahrir mounted its second demonstration outside the Embassy of the Netherlands here after Friday prayers this afternoon, protesting the desecration of a Quran by a Dutch political leader earlier this week

    Some 80 members of the group, including children, had earlier held a peaceful protest outside the Swedish Embassy on Jalan Mayang Sari this morning, to condemn the burning of a Quran by Swedish-Danish politician Rasmus Paludan who leads a Danish party called Stram Kurs (which means Hard Line) outside the Turkish Embassy in Stockholm last week

    He claimed Oskam had “apologised” on behalf of the Netherlands government

    “But for us, the one who did it must apologise and the Netherlands government itself must apologise to all Muslims because the one who did it said his action was allowed by the government,” he told the demonstrators after meeting the Dutch representatives

    Mu’adz also claimed that Muslim leaders did not do enough to give a “stern warning” over Wagensveld’s action

    More than 50 policemen in uniform and plain clothes were observed watching the demonstration outside the Dutch Embassy

  • WHAT’S WRONG WITH LEARNING FROM SINGAPORE’S PUBLIC HOUSING SUCCESS? JOHOR MP ASKS KEDAH MB

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/01/27/whats-wrong-with-learning-from-singapores-public-housing-success-johor-mp-asks-kedah-mb/52149

    01/27/2023, 15:06

    68.42% Shortened!

    Defending Housing and Local Government Minister Nga Kor Ming’s plan to invite experts from other countries, including Singapore, to improve Malaysia’s existing housing policies, Pua said Muhammad Sanusi’s racially-tinged criticism was totally unwarranted

    Puah, who is also Johor PKR vice-chairman, said there is no denying that Singapore’s Housing Development Board (HDB) is one of the most successful housing policies in the world

    He explained that Singapore’s HDB units not only provide quality and affordable housing for its citizens, but its subsequent maintenance is also good

    The Kedah Perikatan Nasional (PN) chief claimed that there is a hidden plan to revive the local government elections by emulating Singapore’s HDB

    Dismissing the claims, Puah said Muhammad Sanusi may not realise that affordable housing is among one of the most pressing issues for young Malaysians

    This is after Nga revealed that his ministry would be meeting with contractors from Singapore’s HDB in order to learn about the island republic’s successful public housing programme.

    ['puah', 'affordable', 'housing', 'government', 'singapore']

    According to SkyscrapersMY, the above building with a rectangular dome is the upcoming Apple Store in Malaysia

    Apple is keeping its new retail store plans under wraps and we can’t confirm if this is indeed the upcoming store

    Meanwhile, the building on the right is a double-storey structure which could be somewhat similar to the Apple Central World store in Thailand

    If the new retail store opens in TRX later this year, it will make Malaysia the 3rd market in Southeast Asia to get an official Apple Store

    In Malaysia, the closest thing we have to an actual Apple Store is an Apple Premium Partner Store located at Pavilion KL

    Gabriel Bankman-Fried,” Sam’s brother

    Discussions with lawyers for Sam Bankman-Fried's father, Joseph Bankman, are "ongoing" and were expected to lead to a consensual outcome, the filing said

    Sam Bankman-Fried should also be subpoenaed by the court, the filing said, as should FTX co-founder Gary Wang and Caroline Ellison, chief executive of trading firm Alameda Research, who, the filing said, “expressly declined to provide the requested information.” The request will be discussed at a Feb

    bankruptcy court in Delaware

    A spokesperson for Sam Bankman-Fried did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

  • SHOUTING ‘HIDUP ISLAM’, BERSATU DEPUTY PRESIDENT LEADS HUNDREDS IN KL MARCH AGAINST SWEDISH GOVT TO PROTEST QURAN BURNING

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/01/27/shouting-hidup-islam-bersatu-deputy-president-leads-hundreds-in-kl-march-against-swedish-govt-to-protest-quran-burning/52155

    01/27/2023

    53.85% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Jan 27 — Hundreds of Perikatan Nasional (PN) supporters led by Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia deputy president Datuk Seri Ahmad Faizal Azumu marched to the Swedish Embassy on Jalan Mayang Sari here this afternoon in another show of protest against a recent Quran burning in Stockholm

    “We have no quarrel with the Swedish nationals but we are very disappointed with their politician for burning the Quran,” he said as the crowd cheered in agreement

    Stressing that the government is not doing enough, PAS Youth chief and Pasir Mas MP, Ahmad Fadhli Shaari urged the government to have a dialogue with Swedish Ambassador in Malaysia, Joachim Bergström

    “We want the government to rise and talk about the matter with the Swedish ambassador regarding this disgusting act by their politician,” he said

    Despite his request, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has already called up the Swedish embassy over the matter yesterday

    This is the second demonstration in front of the Swedish Embassy here today

    ['malaysia', 'ahmad', 'march', 'swedish', 'embassy']

    Other than Noh, speculation has been rife that Umno will take disciplinary action against its former Youth chief Khairy Jamaluddin

  • REPORT: CONTRACT PHARMACISTS THREATEN WALKOUT UNLESS GOVT ENDS INTERVIEWS FOR PERMANENT POSITIONS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/01/27/report-contract-pharmacists-threaten-walkout-unless-govt-ends-interviews-for-permanent-positions/52119

    01/27/2023, 12:07

    66.67% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Jan 27 — Some government hospitals might see their contract pharmacists walk out on the job in protest of a required interview as part of the procedure for permanent positions

    The Star today reported that contract pharmacists are feeling discriminated against and are ready to stage a walkout if their absorption into permanent staff is not valued

    He questioned the need for a 15-minute interview for contract staff to get permanent positions, citing it as a waste of time and an unnecessary step

    Earlier on January 6, Health Minister Dr Zaliha Mustafa announced a total of 4,914 permanent positions will be added to the ministry’s roster

    The movement formed after the Hartal Doktor Kontrak in 2021, when contract doctors staged a nationwide walkout in July 2021 in protest of the government contract system

    According to the Health Ministry’s Health Facts 2022 report, the ratio of doctors to the population in 2021 was one to 420, while pharmacists were one to 1,758.

    ['contract', 'pharmacist', 'interview', 'permanent', 'position']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Jan 27 — Some government hospitals might see their contract pharmacists walk out on the job in protest of a required interview as part of the procedure for permanent positions

    The Star today reported that contract pharmacists are feeling discriminated against and are ready to stage a walkout if their absorption into permanent staff is not valued

    He questioned the need for a 15-minute interview for contract staff to get permanent positions, citing it as a waste of time and an unnecessary step

    Earlier on January 6, Health Minister Dr Zaliha Mustafa announced a total of 4,914 permanent positions will be added to the ministry’s roster

    The movement formed after the Hartal Doktor Kontrak in 2021, when contract doctors staged a nationwide walkout in July 2021 in protest of the government contract system

    According to the Health Ministry’s Health Facts 2022 report, the ratio of doctors to the population in 2021 was one to 420, while pharmacists were one to 1,758.

    ['contract', 'pharmacist', 'interview', 'permanent', 'position']

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2023/01/27/gandhis-killer-a-hero-to-indias-diehard-hindu-nationalists/52116

    01/27/2023, 11:06

    79.31% Shortened!

    but today I command respect for being Godse’s disciple,” he told AFP at his shrine in the bustling city of Meerut, a couple of hours from New Delhi by car

    ‘Cannot stop this storm’ Sharma and his followers hold daily prayers in front of the Godse idol, chanting religious sermons that accuse Gandhi of betraying the nation despite his role in mobilising the mass protests that brought India’s independence

    “It is because of Gandhi and his ideology that India was divided and Hindus had to bow before Muslims and outsiders,” said Abhishek Agarwal, like Sharma a member of the century-old radical Hindu Mahasabha group

    “But now Gandhi is exposed and Godse’s word is spreading far and wide

    The secular leaders cannot stop this storm and there will be a time when Gandhi’s name will be wiped out from the pious land,” he told AFP

    Tushar told AFP that Godse’s veneration was the direct result of an ideology espoused by Modi’s government that risked sowing the “seeds of our destruction”

    ['hindu', 'sharma', 'gandhi', 'godse', 'india']

  • DOZENS OF MUSLIMS, INCLUDING CHILDREN, GATHER IN FRONT OF SWEDISH EMBASSY IN KL TO PROTEST QURAN BURNING IN STOCKHOLM (VIDEO)

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/01/27/dozens-of-muslims-including-children-gather-in-front-of-swedish-embassy-in-kl-to-protest-quran-burning-in-stockholm-video/52107

    01/27/2023, 10:12

    62.5% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Jan 27 — Some 80 people from a local hardline Muslim group calling itself Hizbut Tahrir have gathered in front of the Swedish Embassy here in a show of protest against the burning of the Quran in Stockholm last week

    Last Saturday, Swedish-Danish far-right politician Rasmus Paludan who leads a Danish party called Stram Kurs (which means Hard Line) burnt a copy of the Quran outside the Turkish Embassy in Stockholm, sparking outrage across the Muslim world

    However, Swedish authorities have said Paludan’s act did not violate its laws

    In his speech, Mu’adz said Hizbut Tahrir will continue to hold peaceful demonstrations until the Swedish government makes Paludan apologise for burning the Quran

    “We call on the Swedish government to order Paludan to issue an apology to Muslims for his cruel insult to Islam which has angered Muslims around the world

    More Muslims are expected to turn up outside the Swedish Embassy here later today to register their protest

    ['muslim', 'group', 'swedish', 'embassy', 'quran']

    But the United boss has proved to be too tough an act to follow for Schreuder, who leaves with Ajax fifth in the table

    The final straw for the Ajax board came on Thursday night when they saw Schreuder's men held to a draw by relegation threatened Volendam

    Ajax even fell behind in that game, with the club deciding that Schreuder is not the man to turn their form around

    "Ajax has immediately suspended Alfred Schreuder

  • POLICE: SOME MALAYSIANS RESCUED FROM CAMBODIAN SCAM SYNDICATES RETURNED THERE DUE TO LUCRATIVE EARNINGS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/01/27/police-some-malaysians-rescued-from-cambodian-scam-syndicates-returned-there-due-to-lucrative-earnings/52196

    01/27/2023

    56.25% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise SEPANG, Jan 27 — Some Malaysians who had lucrative jobs in Cambodia's scam syndicates have made their way back there even after being rescued, Bukit Aman Criminal Investigation Department director Datuk Seri Abd Jalil Hassan said today

    “But some have reached their KPIs and don't want to come home even though we want to rescue them

    “Even if we return them back home, they make a U-turn and go back to Cambodia,” Abd Jalil told reporters during a press conference held at Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA) this afternoon

    When asked by reporters if there are any penalties for those who make a return back to Cambodia to work as scam syndicates, Abd Jalil said that there is nothing authorities can do except fulfil their responsibility to keep Malaysians safe

    “If a Malaysian comes to us for help, we have the responsibility to help them

    “If we don't help them, how would the public perceive us? Even if we help them to the best of our abilities, the public's perception might not change,” he said

    Today, five Malaysians were brought back following a police delegation to Cambodia to look into the alleged job scams there.

    ['malaysian', 'job', 'cambodia', 'scam', 'back']

  • RECALL: ALL 2019-2023 BMW R 1250 GS MAY HAVE GEARBOX INPUT SHAFT BREAK

    https://www.rideapart.com/news/633453/bmw-r1250gs-gearbox-shaft-recall/

    01/27/2023

    50.0% Shortened!

    On January 18, 2023, BMW of North America announced a safety recall for all 2019 through 2023 R 1250 GS, R 1250 GS Adventure, and R 1250 RTP motorcycles due to the potential risk of a broken gearbox input shaft

    This could, in turn, block the rear wheel, which could increase the risk of a crash.  According to BMW, approximately 18,489 motorcycles are involved in this recall, which represents 100 percent of the population

    BMW intensified its analysis of the issue, and eventually determined that if there is an abrupt difference between the engine speed and the rotational speed of the final drive component, the gearbox input shaft could become overloaded, and break as a result

    That’s why BMW decided to issue this recall.  Owners will be notified via postal mail that they should stop riding their affected bikes and contact their local authorized BMW dealer for recall service

    BMW has also issued a Stop Sale notice to its dealers for all affected 2019 through 2023 R 1250 GS, R 1250 GS Adventure, and R 1250 RTP bikes until recall service has been performed.  BMW North America notified its dealer network about this recall on January 18, 2023

    Owners may contact BMW customer service at 1-800-525-7417

    ['bmw', 'recall', 'gearbox', 'input', 'shaft']

    On January 18, 2023, BMW of North America announced a safety recall for all 2019 through 2023 R 1250 GS, R 1250 GS Adventure, and R 1250 RTP motorcycles due to the potential risk of a broken gearbox input shaft

    This could, in turn, block the rear wheel, which could increase the risk of a crash.  According to BMW, approximately 18,489 motorcycles are involved in this recall, which represents 100 percent of the population

    BMW intensified its analysis of the issue, and eventually determined that if there is an abrupt difference between the engine speed and the rotational speed of the final drive component, the gearbox input shaft could become overloaded, and break as a result

    That’s why BMW decided to issue this recall.  Owners will be notified via postal mail that they should stop riding their affected bikes and contact their local authorized BMW dealer for recall service

    BMW has also issued a Stop Sale notice to its dealers for all affected 2019 through 2023 R 1250 GS, R 1250 GS Adventure, and R 1250 RTP bikes until recall service has been performed.  BMW North America notified its dealer network about this recall on January 18, 2023

    Owners may contact BMW customer service at 1-800-525-7417

    ['bmw', 'recall', 'gearbox', 'input', 'shaft']

    Odd-job worker Raman Balakrishnan pleaded not guilty to house trespass under the Penal Code before magistrate Norshazwani Ishak

    Raman, who was unrepresented, asked for bail, saying he had to look after his mother

    “I hope the court can grant me bail as I need to take my mother to her hospital appointments,” he said

    Raman also asked for a low bail, claiming he only earned about RM1,000 a month

    Magistrate Norshazwani then set bail at RM16,000 with two sureties

    The case will be mentioned again at the Bahau Magistrate’s Court on Feb 22

    Last year, a French arbitration court ordered Malaysia to pay the descendants of the Sultan of Sulu US$14.92bil

    Stampa, who is from Spain, issued the award in a Paris court of arbitration where Malaysia was not represented.

    Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said

  • RAFIZI’S PUSH FOR CONSUMER ACTION GOOD BUT ACTUAL POLICIES WOULD BE BETTER, ANALYSTS SAY

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2023/01/27/rafizis-push-for-consumer-action-good-but-actual-policies-would-be-better-analysts-say/51788

    01/27/2023, 08:05

    87.76% Shortened!

    In November 2022, Malaysia’s inflation remained elevated at 4 per cent year-on-year compared to October but prices of food and non-alcoholic beverages continued to register an upward trend, staying above the 7 per cent range to become the lead component driving up the consumer price index

    Food and drinks make up the most of the average household income expenditure, accounting for up to 30 per cent according to official data

    From this, over 11 per cent is spent on eating out, according to Rafizi

    He told consumers that they were also partly responsible for the continued rise in food prices in Malaysia, as he called for a “collective” effort to rein in soaring inflation

    “In my view, inflation in Malaysia is about low income

    Consumer groups and associations should be doing this and disseminate information for consumer use,” he added

    ['rafizi', 'government', 'say', 'consumer', 'price']

  • MIKEL ARTETA LISTS FOUR WAYS PEP GUARDIOLA INSPIRED HIM AND ARSENAL SUCCESS

    https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/mikel-arteta-lists-four-ways-29058319

    01/27/2023, 07:06

    71.43% Shortened!

    Mikel Arteta will go up against his mentor Pep Guardiola on Friday night in Arsenal's FA Cup fourth round clash with Manchester City at the Etihad Stadium Mikel Arteta has stepped out of Pep Guardiola's shadow but says his mentor will always be celebrated as a pioneer who changed the face of football

    Like Guardiola's predecessor as Barcelona coach, Johan Cruyff, the Arsenal manager regards the Manchester City boss as a visionary who unfurled a new blueprint for others to follow

    “For what people think of me, I accept it - because I probably wouldn’t have had the career I had as a player, the understanding of the game or the purpose I had as a player, if he hadn’t been in that time at Barcelona

    “But I think the influence that Pep had on football in the last 20 years is just incredibly powerful

    “What inspired me was his way of thinking, his way of transmitting his beliefs, the way he understood the game, the passion he had about the game

    Let’s see and let everybody develop in the way they should.” New signings Jakub Kiwior and Leandro Trossard are likely to feature at the Etihad in a plum tie which, Arteta insists, will have no bearing on the title race but will tell Arsenal “a lot about where we are” in terms of their squad depth

    “For what people think of me, I accept it - because I probably wouldn’t have had the career I had as a player, the understanding of the game or the purpose I had as a player, if he hadn’t been in that time at Barcelona

  • 'DECLAN RICE SIGNING FOR ARSENAL!' AS MOISES CAICEDO DEVELOPMENT TRIGGERS NEW TRANSFER THEORY

    https://www.football.london/arsenal-fc/transfer-news/declan-rice-arsenal-transfer-theory-26078445

    01/27/2023

    57.14% Shortened!

    Declan Rice is reportedly Arsenal's top transfer target for the summer window, but some supporters have a brilliant theory regarding a move before the end of this month Sign up to the free Arsenal newsletter so you don't miss the latest Gunners news, straight to your inbox We have more newsletters Signing a midfielder would be the ideal scenario for Arsenal before the January transfer window closes on Tuesday night, Mikel Arteta has revealed

    "Well, we need some more cover in midfield ideally if we can," the Spaniard toldfootball.london

    After all, it was public knowledge that Arsenal were interested in Raphinha and Lisandro Martinez during last summer's transfer window and then Mykhailo Mudryk this month

    Hence a change of approach from Arteta and sporting director Edu Gaspar? Well, when it comes to stunning transfer theories, not many are better at it than Arsenal supporters and a brand new one has been created that involves Declan Rice with a midfield signing the priority between now and Tuesday night

    Caicedo talk has to be a smokescreen"

    Of course, these Arsenal fans are unlikely to be proven right - well at least this month at least - as whilst Rice is reportedly a target for the Premier League leaders, it's said that any potential deal will happen at the end of the season with West Ham United understandably reluctant to sell before Tuesday

    ['rice', 'arsenal', 'transfer', 'well', 'caicedo']

    Declan Rice is reportedly Arsenal's top transfer target for the summer window, but some supporters have a brilliant theory regarding a move before the end of this month Sign up to the free Arsenal newsletter so you don't miss the latest Gunners news, straight to your inbox We have more newsletters Signing a midfielder would be the ideal scenario for Arsenal before the January transfer window closes on Tuesday night, Mikel Arteta has revealed

    "Well, we need some more cover in midfield ideally if we can," the Spaniard toldfootball.london

    After all, it was public knowledge that Arsenal were interested in Raphinha and Lisandro Martinez during last summer's transfer window and then Mykhailo Mudryk this month

    Haikal-Arif are currently ranked No

    46 while Chun Meng-Boon Zhe are ranked 156th in the world

    The timing of Sze Fei-Izzuddin’s decision is also not ideal as the one-year qualification period for the 2024 Paris Olympics begins in May and they had been earmarked as one of the pairs capable of making the cut

    Now, Sze Fei and Izzuddin will be faced with the challenge of starting from scratch with new partners and will need to race against time to climb the rankings quickly if they hope to qualify for the Olympics

    9 independent pair Ong Yew Sin-Teo Ee Yi are both ahead of Sze Fei-Izzuddin in the race to Paris

    The Nasdaq is up 2.7% so far this week and on pace for its best month since last summer

    Economic growth slowed in the fourth quarter compared with the third, a sign the Federal Reserve’s aggressive interest rate increases last year are kicking in

    Initial jobless claims of 186,000 came in lower than the 205,000 expected for last week and also below the week before that

    The Fed will meet next week to decide on the next step for interest rates, and most expect it will raise by another quarter of a percentage point, which is a smaller increment than at its previous meetings

    That implies another rate hike or two after next week’s meeting if the Fed meets expectations

    In its forecast, IBM said free cashflow in fiscal 2023 is expected to be US$10.5bil (RM44.7bil) while revenue will increase in the mid-single digits

    IBM still expects to hire in the “higher-growth areas,” Kavanaugh said

    In its forecast, IBM said free cashflow in fiscal 2023 is expected to be US$10.5bil (RM44.7bil) while revenue will increase in the mid-single digits

    The company’s revenue increased in 2022 for the second consecutive year after almost a decade of no growth or slipping sales

    Fourth-quarter revenue was unchanged at US$16.7bil (RM71.1bil), the Armonk, New York-based company said in a statement

    IBM’s current headcount is 260,000, Kavanaugh said

  • THREE YEARS ON, THE BATTLE IS NOT YET OVER

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2023/01/27/three-years-on-the-battle-is-not-yet-over

    01/27/2023

    77.42% Shortened!

    However, the virus is here to stay, say health experts

    Prof Dr Moy Foong Ming of Universiti Malaya, a public health expert, said Malaysia has been one of the best countries in managing Covid-19 and has handled the pandemic well despite some initial hiccups

    Public health expert Prof Dr Sharifa Ezat Wan Puteh of Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia said the high number of deaths was unavoidable at one point as there was a severe health resource shortage and a lack of facilities, as well as proper isolation centres

    Besides Covid-19, Malaysia’s burden of non-communicable diseases (NCDs) such as obesity, hypertension and stroke are also high

    Universiti Malaya professor of epidemiology and public health Prof Dr Sanjay Rampal said while the Health Ministry responded well to the initial pandemic, future resilience would be highly dependent on investments in public health and healthcare systems

    “Improving disaster resilience and strengthening public health and healthcare systems will be more cost-effective ways to prepare for future health threats,” he said

    Report it to us

    ['covid', 'malaysia', 'pandemic', 'say', 'health']

    However, the virus is here to stay, say health experts

    Public health expert Prof Dr Sharifa Ezat Wan Puteh of Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia said the high number of deaths was unavoidable at one point as there was a severe health resource shortage and a lack of facilities, as well as proper isolation centres

    Besides Covid-19, Malaysia’s burden of non-communicable diseases (NCDs) such as obesity, hypertension and stroke are also high

    Universiti Malaya professor of epidemiology and public health Prof Dr Sanjay Rampal said while the Health Ministry responded well to the initial pandemic, future resilience would be highly dependent on investments in public health and healthcare systems

    “Improving disaster resilience and strengthening public health and healthcare systems will be more cost-effective ways to prepare for future health threats,” he said

  • JAPAN TO DROP MASK GUIDANCE, RELAX COVID-19 STRATEGY

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/japan-covid-19-drop-mask-guidance-indoors-downgrade-medical-classification-3236261

    01/27/2023

    57.14% Shortened!

    Masks are commonly worn indoors and outdoors in Japan

    "As for masking, regardless of indoors and outdoors, the decision will be left up to individuals," Kishida told a televised government meeting

    Even before the pandemic erupted in 2020, many people in Japan used masks when they had a cold or hayfever or to ward off illness in the winter

    The change means that from May 8 - after Japan's Golden Week holiday period - COVID-19 patients and their close contacts will no longer have to isolate

    By clicking subscribe, I agree to receive news updates and promotional material from Mediacorp and Mediacorp's partners.

  • MALAYSIA RESPECTS 2008 ICJ RULING ON PEDRA BRANCA, BUT SAYS 2018 MOVE TO WITHDRAW REVIEW APPLICATION WAS 'IMPROPER'

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/malaysia-icj-ruling-pedra-branca-application-withdraw-review-2018-improper-3236041

    01/27/2023

    75.0% Shortened!

    The International Court of Justice ruled in 2008 that Singapore had sovereignty over Pedra Branca

    In May 2018, Malaysia said it would discontinue an application for revision and a request for interpretation of the ICJ’s 2008 judgment

    “Following the agreement between Malaysia and the Republic of Singapore on 23rd May 2018 to discontinue the two Applications, the ICJ by an Order dated 29th May 2018, had informed Malaysia and the Republic of Singapore that the Court had placed on record the discontinuance of the two Applications and directed the cases to be removed from the Court’s List,” the attorney-general at the time said

    The matter was brought to the ICJ in 2003, and on May 23, 2008, it ruled that Singapore had sovereignty over Pedra Branca, while Middle Rocks was awarded to Malaysia and South Ledge belonged to the state in whose territorial waters it is located

    "After the Court's decision, both Singapore and Malaysia publicly announced that they will accept and abide by the Court's decision which is final," MFA said

    "In 2017, Malaysia instituted an application for revision and a request for interpretation of the Court's 2008 decision, which were subsequently withdrawn by Malaysia in 2018

    ['court', 'singapore', 'sovereignty', 'pedra', 'branca']

    The International Court of Justice ruled in 2008 that Singapore had sovereignty over Pedra Branca

    In May 2018, Malaysia said it would discontinue an application for revision and a request for interpretation of the ICJ’s 2008 judgment

    “Following the agreement between Malaysia and the Republic of Singapore on 23rd May 2018 to discontinue the two Applications, the ICJ by an Order dated 29th May 2018, had informed Malaysia and the Republic of Singapore that the Court had placed on record the discontinuance of the two Applications and directed the cases to be removed from the Court’s List,” the attorney-general at the time said

    The matter was brought to the ICJ in 2003, and on May 23, 2008, it ruled that Singapore had sovereignty over Pedra Branca, while Middle Rocks was awarded to Malaysia and South Ledge belonged to the state in whose territorial waters it is located

    "After the Court's decision, both Singapore and Malaysia publicly announced that they will accept and abide by the Court's decision which is final," MFA said

    "In 2017, Malaysia instituted an application for revision and a request for interpretation of the Court's 2008 decision, which were subsequently withdrawn by Malaysia in 2018

    ['court', 'singapore', 'sovereignty', 'pedra', 'branca']



  • KOLO TOURE AXED BY WIGAN AFTER JUST 58 DAYS

    01/27/2023, 06:09

    60.0% Shortened!

    Wigan Athletic have parted ways with head coach Kolo Toure only 58 days after appointing him, with the former Arsenal and Manchester City defender failing to win any of his nine matches in charge

    The 41-year-old was appointed to his first managerial post on a three-and-a-half-year contract on Nov

    12, before the pause in competition for the 2022 World Cup

    "Unfortunately, the results on the field have not been as we would have liked and as tough a decision as this was, the Board felt it necessary to give us the best possible chance of remaining a Championship club next season," Wigan chief executive Malachy Brannigan said in a club statement

    "We know that this time of year is a key period for any football club, ourselves included

    "We are delighted that Kolo has become the new manager of Wigan Athletic Football Club, and the board are pleased that he is the man to take us forward," Brannigan said when Toure was signed less than two months ago

    ['wigan', 'athletic', 'toure', 'appoint', 'cup']

    Vitor Roque Gazzetta dello Sport have linked United with a move for the 17-year-old attacker from Athletico Paranaense

    He has a release clause of around £52.7 million, which is a lot for a player unproven in Europe but considerably less than some of the other strikers United have been linked with

    Varela reportedly has a release clause of around £18m which would tick the box of a cheap alternative from South America

  • DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT RETIRING UNTIL YOU HAVE THESE 3 THINGS FULLY PAID OFF — AND NO, YOUR MORTGAGE ISN'T ONE OF THEM

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/dont-even-think-retiring-until-153000554.html

    81.25% Shortened!

    So all those payments take away from your retirement income

    As of December 2022, the average new car loan for a buyer with great credit was 8.6%, according to MyAutoloan

    But if you have bad credit, that average soars up to 22.16%

    That’s about as much as the interest rate on a credit card

    If $400 goes into a car payment, and $300 to a credit card and more for student loans, suddenly you have far less cash on hand for your retirement

    So why not pay down your mortgage too? It’s not just the cheaper borrowing costs, although with the average national mortgage rate for a 30-year fixed rate at 6.15%, that is an advantage

    ['retirement', 'pay', 'loan', 'mortgage', 'interest']

Sign up for our daily newsletter to get the day's biggest stories sent direct to your inbox We have more newsletters From Gustavo Scarpa to Andrey Santos, a number of South American stars have made the switch to the Premier League this month

    The last signing Manchester United made directly from South America was Facundo Pellistri and while it's a little too early to judge his move to Old Trafford, the club doesn't have the best record when it comes to bringing talents over from South America, with the likes of Guillermo Varela and Kleberson failing to make an impact in the Premier League

    Vitor Roque Gazzetta dello Sport have linked United with a move for the 17-year-old attacker from Athletico Paranaense

    He has a release clause of around £52.7 million, which is a lot for a player unproven in Europe but considerably less than some of the other strikers United have been linked with

    Varela reportedly has a release clause of around £18m which would tick the box of a cheap alternative from South America

    Marcus Rashford has been in fine form this season but he could eventually move into the centre, meaning another winger could help Erik ten Hag

    ['united', 'south', 'america', 'talent', 'move']



  • INDIA'S ADANI SLAMMED BY US$48 BILLION STOCK ROUT, CLOUDING RECORD SHARE SALE

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/business/india-adani-short-seller-trigger-record-sale-share-billion-3236086

    01/27/2023

    86.36% Shortened!

    Spokespersons for the regulator and Adani had no immediate comment

    Market worries extended to Indian banks with exposure to Adani Group's debt

    Shares of other listed Adani firms also plummeted, with Adani Transmission Ltd, Adani Total Gas, Adani Green Energy and Adani Ports sinking 20 per cent each

    Adani Ports, Adani Green Energy and Adani Transmission marked their worst intraday drop ever, with heavy volumes

    Adani Group has repeatedly faced and dismissed concerns about its debt levels

    Adani has said its debt is at a manageable level and that no investor has raised any concern

  • INTEL'S 'HISTORIC COLLAPSE' ERASES $8 BILLION FROM MARKET VALUE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/tech/tech-news/2023/01/27/intel039s-039historic-collapse039-sparks-selloff-in-chip-stocks

    01/27/2023

    58.82% Shortened!

    Visitors are seen at the Intel booth during the China Digital Entertainment Expo and Conference, also known as ChinaJoy, in Shanghai, China July 30, 2021

    Intel shares closed 6.4% lower, while rival Advanced Micro Devices and Nvidia ended the session up 0.3% and 2.8%, respectively

    Intel supplier KLA Corp settled 6.9% lower after its dismal forecast

    The company has been steadily losing market share to rivals like AMD, which has used contract chipmakers such as Taiwan-based TSMC to make chips that outpace Intel's technology

    "AMD's Genoa and Bergamo (data center) chips have a strong price-performance advantage compared to Intel's Sapphire Rapids processors, which should drive further AMD share gains," said Matt Wegner, analyst at YipitData

    "It is now clear why Intel needs to cut so much cost as the company's original plans prove to be fantasy," brokerage Bernstein said

    "The magnitude of the deterioration is stunning, and brings potential concern to the company's cash position over time." Intel, which plans to cut $3 billion in costs this year, generated $7.7 billion in cash from operations in the fourth quarter and paid dividends of $1.5 billion

    ['intel', 'billion', 'market', 'company', 'quarter']

    01/27/2023

    60.0% Shortened!

    Friday, 27 Jan 2023

    Anwar said the US President also expressed commitment to deepen the country's relations with Malaysia, including in the areas of digital economy, climate crisis, and energy security

    "I look forward to working closely with him (Biden) for the mutual benefit of our people,” Anwar said as he uploaded the congratulatory message from Biden on Facebook Friday

    Biden in his note, dated Jan 24, said as democracies around the world face unprecedented challenges, Malaysia’s election demonstrated that democracies can deliver

    Biden also pointed out that the relationship between both countries was built on a strong foundation of the ever-growing economy, security and people-to-people ties which have also helped strengthen freedom, security and prosperity in the Indo-Pacific

    "Together, we can advance a free, open, secure and prosperous region - one that benefits both of our people,” he added

    Gusto, 19, is out of contract with Lyon in June 2024

    Aulas closing the door on a potential move could be seen as him trying to put pressure on Chelsea to increase their first offer and agree to let Gusto stay at Lyon on loan until the end of the season, which Chelsea have refused to agree to so far in the negotiations

    Gusto has now played 47 times already with Lyon, his hometown club, including some European games and he is also on Didier Deschamps' radar for the national team after having represented France in every youth team

    Gusto is a very attacking right back with great pace and crossing ability.

    01/27/2023

    60.0% Shortened!

    Wigan Athletic have parted ways with head coach Kolo Toure only 58 days after appointing him, with the former Arsenal and Manchester City defender failing to win any of his nine matches in charge

    The 41-year-old was appointed to his first managerial post on a three-and-a-half-year contract on Nov

    12, before the pause in competition for the 2022 World Cup

    "Unfortunately, the results on the field have not been as we would have liked and as tough a decision as this was, the Board felt it necessary to give us the best possible chance of remaining a Championship club next season," Wigan chief executive Malachy Brannigan said in a club statement

    "We know that this time of year is a key period for any football club, ourselves included

    "We are delighted that Kolo has become the new manager of Wigan Athletic Football Club, and the board are pleased that he is the man to take us forward," Brannigan said when Toure was signed less than two months ago

    ['wigan', 'athletic', 'toure', 'appoint', 'cup']

  • SANCTIONS MOVE CHINA TO REPLACE CHIPS SUPPLY CHAIN

    https://asiatimes.com/2023/01/sanctions-move-china-to-replace-chips-supply-chain/

    01/27/2023

    86.96% Shortened!

    The most important type of semiconductor production equipment subject to US export restrictions is EUV (Extreme Ultra-Violet) lithography, which is monopolized by ASML

    ASML has not sold any EUV lithography systems to China

    Rather, China would not be able to add much new semiconductor production capacity without developing its own equipment

    But EUV lithography accounted for 46%, so China accounted for 26% of the remainder

    Only 40 of the 345 lithography units sold by ASML in 2022 were EUV

    It’s a complex industry

    ['asml', 'lithography', 'equipment', 'semiconductor', 'china']

  • 2023 HYUNDAI IONIQ 5 MAX EV UPDATED IN MALAYSIA - WITH HUD, NO MORE SOLAR ROOF, SAME 72.6 KWH BATTERY - PAULTAN.ORG

    https://paultan.org/2023/01/27/2023-hyundai-ioniq-5-max-ev-updated-in-malaysia-with-hud-no-more-solar-roof-same-72-6-kwh-battery/

    01/27/2023

    73.91% Shortened!

    Powertrain and battery specifications remain as before, with the Lite and Plus being the single-motor, RWD variants powered by a 58 kWh battery that offers a maximum range of 384 km on the WLTP cycle, while the Max similarly continues to get a 72.6 kWh battery with up to 430 km of battery range (WLTP) on offer

    The blind spot view monitor is specified on the Plus and Max variants, while the base Lite gets Safe Exit Assist warning, and the Plus and Max gain the active assist version of the Safe Exit Alert system

    Inside, the 2023 Ioniq 5 gets cloth upholstery in the Lite variant, while the Plus and Max get leather trim

    Front seat adjustment in automatic for the driver and manual for the passenger in the Lite, while Plus and Max both get electric adjustment for both driver and front passenger seats

    According to the Hyundai Malaysia website, the Ioniq 5 is now priced at RM207,808 for the 58 kWh Lite, RM238,408 for the 58 kWh Plus, and RM270,408 for the top 72.6 kWh Max

    We’ve reviewed the 2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 in range-topping Max guise; check out the review here

    ['ioniq', 'variant', 'lite', 'plus', 'max']

    The blind spot view monitor is specified on the Plus and Max variants, while the base Lite gets Safe Exit Assist warning, and the Plus and Max gain the active assist version of the Safe Exit Alert system
