  • ARSENAL IN CONTROL OF TITLE RACE, BUT TOUGHER TESTS TO COME

    https://www.espn.com.sg/soccer/arsenal-engarsenal/story/4859207/arsenal-in-control-of-title-race-but-tougher-tests-are-to-come-as-man-city-games-loom

    01/23/2023

    78.57% Shortened!

    But despite a five-point lead at the top, and with second-place City having played an extra game, Arsenal have only reached the halfway point of the season

    A five-point lead at the halfway stage is by no means a key indicator of a successful title challenge, especially when you have still to play your biggest rivals home and away -- the team most likely to deny you top spot at the end of the season

    It is a game that will draw obvious comparisons to Manchester United's 1-0 win at Newcastle in March 1996, when Eric Cantona's winner triggered Newcastle's collapse and signalled United's charge to the title

    Arsenal simply have to avoid Newcastle's fate and ensure that they don't hand City the momentum next month

    They could also replicate the form that took Leicester City to a shock title in 2015-16, when Claudio Ranieri's team stunned the football world to win the Premier League

    (Though, after 19 games, Leicester were second on goal difference to Arsenal.) When Arsene Wenger led Arsenal to the first of his three Premier League titles in 1997-98, the Gunners were 13 points behind leaders United at the halfway stage, with a game in hand, yet his team finished a point clear of United at the top

    ['united', 'title', 'arsenal', 'city', 'point']

  • HOCKEY: MALAYSIA LOST CROSSOVER STAGE TO SPAIN

    https://www.thestar.com.my/sport/hockey/2023/01/22/hockey-malaysia-lost-crossover-stage-to-spain

    01/22/2023, 22:05

    71.43% Shortened!

    In the first quarter, Spain had two penalty corners, one in the first minute and the second in the 12th minute

    But Malaysia dealt with those two situations, with the first shot being stopped by Zulpidaus Mizun and the second penalty corner being saved by goalkeeper Hafizuddin Othman

    In the second quarter, Malaysia looked better in terms of movement and circle penetration, but Spain had the best chance in the 20th minute when Joaquin Menini unleashed a reverse stick shot, which Hafizuddin saved beautifully

    Spain's resurgence was rewarded when they got a penalty stroke in the 40th minute, and Marc Miralles buried it from the spot

    A few seconds later, a lapse in defending saw Malaysia concede a second when Xavier Gispert scored for Spain

    In the last one minute of the game, Spain had three penalty corners to get the winner but Malaysia’s defence stayed resolute, especially Hafizuddin who continued with his stellar saves

    ['quarter', 'spain', 'penalty', 'score', 'minute']

  • INDIA BLOCKS BBC DOCUMENTARY ON PM MODI FROM AIRING IN INDIA

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/india-blocks-bbc-documentary-pm-modi-airing-india-3224001

    01/22/2023, 18:05

    64.71% Shortened!

    Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi delivers his speech during a rally in Mumbai, India on Jan 19, 2023

    While the BBC has not aired the documentary in India, the video was uploaded on some YouTube channels, Gupta said

    New Delhi has issued orders to Twitter to block over 50 tweets linking to the video of the documentary and YouTube has been instructed to block any uploads of the video, he added

    Both YouTube and Twitter have complied with the directions, Gupta said

    Modi was the chief minister of the western state of Gujarat when it was gripped by communal riots that left more than 1,000 people dead, by government count - most of them Muslims

    Modi was later named the head of his party, the Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party, which he led to power in general elections in 2014 and then in 2019

    The center-left Argentine leader has already traveled to Brazil for a bilateral meeting, held on Jan 2, the day after Lula took office

    ['brasilia', 'brazil', 'president', 'lula', 'bolsonaro']

    Army officers stand guard outside the Planalto Palace, in Brasilia, Brazil on Jan 11, 2023

    And he suggested that the results of the October election in which Lula defeated Bolsonaro should be accepted

    On Sunday Lula will head to Argentina, the customary first stop for Brazilian presidents

    "Everyone wants to talk to Brazil," Lula said this week in an interview with the Globo TV channel, promising to rebuild Brasilia's ties with the international community after Bolsonaro's four years in office were marked by international isolation for the country

    Lula arrives in Buenos Aires on Sunday and will meet with Fernandez the following day

    The center-left Argentine leader has already traveled to Brazil for a bilateral meeting, held on Jan 2, the day after Lula took office

    ['brasilia', 'brazil', 'president', 'lula', 'bolsonaro']

  • LAST YEAR WAS 'DIFFICULT' FOR HEALTHCARE SECTOR WITH THREE COVID-19 INFECTION WAVES: ONG YE KUNG

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/singapore/last-year-2022-difficult-healthcare-sector-three-covid-19-infection-waves-ong-ye-kung-3223806

    01/22/2023

    50.0% Shortened!

    Health Minister Ong Ye Kung was at Sengkang General Hospital on the first day of the Chinese New Year to express his appreciation to healthcare staff who are working to keep essential healthcare services running over the holiday period

    Health Minister Ong Ye Kung visited Sengkang General Hospital to welcome the Year of the Rabbit with the staff and patients on Jan 22, 2023

    Mr Ong was at Sengkang General Hospital on the first day of the Chinese New Year to express his appreciation to healthcare staff who are working to keep essential healthcare services running over the holiday period

    "I think Singaporeans can feel that life (has) gone back to normal, but to healthcare workers, it was not normal, it was the most difficult year to have to go through three infection waves," he added

    Singapore saw three COVID-19 waves in 2022 - the BA.2 Omicron subvariant in April, the wave driven by the BA.4 and BA.5 subvariants in July, and the recent wave driven by the XBB variant.  "So today on the first day of Chinese New Year, I come here, although just to Sengkang Hospital, but really, it's to carry a message to all our healthcare workers, to thank you, especially for the last year, for all that you have done," Mr Ong said

    Be among the first to know the Breaking news

    ['singapore', 'ong', 'kung', 'sengkang', 'hospital']

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/asia/china-chinese-pray-health-new-year-covid-19-death-toll-rises-3223711

    01/22/2023

    75.0% Shortened!

    Visitors walk across a bridge decorated with lanterns at a public park in Beijing on the first day of the Chinese New Year holiday on Jan

    One Beijing resident said she wished the year of the rabbit will bring "health to everyone"

    Chinese health experts say the wave of infections across the country has already peaked

    China on Jan 14 reported nearly 60,000 COVID-related deaths in hospitals between Dec 8 and Jan 12, a huge increase from the 5,000-plus deaths reported previously over the entire pandemic period

    Some health experts expect that more than one million people will die from the disease in China this year, with British-based health data firm Airfinity forecasting COVID-19 fatalities could hit 36,000 a day this week

    About 110 million railway passenger trips are estimated to have been made during Jan 7 to 21, the first 15 days of the 40-day Chinese New Year travel rush, up 28 per cent year-on-year, People's Daily, the Communist Party's official newspaper reported

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2023/01/22/thailand-rising-star-vitidsarn-stuns-world-no-1-axelsen-to-clinch-india-open-badminton-title

    01/22/2023

    68.42% Shortened!

    Sunday, 22 Jan 2023

    Thailand’s Kunlavut Vitidsarn wears his winning medal against Denmark’s Viktor Axelsen during their men's singles final match of the Yonex Sunrise India Open 2023 in New Delhi on January 22, 2023

    In the women's singles, South Korea's An Se-young beat world number one Akane Yamaguchi of Japan in New Delhi to avenge her loss at the Malaysia Open final last week

    "From my earlier losses against Viktor, I had learnt that if I could engage him in long rallies and take the match to the decider then I have a chance to win," said Vitidsarn, who lost the World Championships final to Axelsen last year

    I gave it whatever I had." Axelsen, who won the Malaysia open title, bounced back after a close opening game but Vitidsarn kept his calm to win his first major Super Series crown since he won the German Open (Super 300) last year

    An bounced back from a game down to beat Yamaguchi 15-21, 21-16, 21-12 in a 62-minute battle of the Super 750 event

    ['vitidsarn', 'axelsen', 'final', 'open', 'world']

    Sunday, 22 Jan 2023

    Thailand’s Kunlavut Vitidsarn wears his winning medal against Denmark’s Viktor Axelsen during their men's singles final match of the Yonex Sunrise India Open 2023 in New Delhi on January 22, 2023

    In the women's singles, South Korea's An Se-young beat world number one Akane Yamaguchi of Japan in New Delhi to avenge her loss at the Malaysia Open final last week

  • APPLE, SAMSUNG, XIAOMI: WHO SOLD THE MOST SMARTPHONES IN 2022?

    https://www.gizchina.com/2023/01/22/apple-samsung-xiaomi-who-sold-the-most-smartphones-in-2022/

    01/22/2023

    86.36% Shortened!

    Xiaomi, Oppo, and Vivo, their Top 5 competitors, are all lagging behind

    The top three are Samsung, Apple, and Xiaomi

    Then we have Oppo and Vivo completing the top 5

    Samsung rises from 20 to 22% and Apple from 17 to 19%, while Xiaomi drops from 14 to 13% and Oppo and Vivo drop to 9% of global sales

    With 23% of the market share in 2020 and 2021, the Apple brand ultimately took the top spot with 25% of sales this year

    While the percentages for Xiaomi, Oppo, and Vivo are 18.41% loss for Xiaomi, 16.86% for Vivo, and 25.57% fall for Oppo, the latter is the worst loser in history

    ['samsung', 'apple', 'market', 'xiaomi', 'oppo']

  • YOURSAY | MINISTER, STOP BEING A DEFENDER OF TOUCH 'N GO

    https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/652481

    01/22/2023

    86.67% Shortened!

    Recently, I parked for three hours at a public hospital using my TNG card but when I exited, also swiping my card, I found RM12 deducted from my e-wallet

    I wanted a normal plain RM10 TNG card

    They are selling a special edition TNG card costing RM25

    The RM10 card has been out of stock everywhere and for a long time

    I had only noticed after checking my balance from the e-wallet that my RFID card had been deducting money from both sides, at the entry point and at the exit point

    I discontinued RFID use thereafter and started using my TNG Card

    ['tng', 'toll', 'use', 'card', 'exit']

    Sunday, 22 Jan 2023

    Kota Tinggi Fire and Rescue Department operation commander Khairul Sufian Dahari said the search and rescue operation is now for the second victim, who is a 17-year-old boy

    The first victim is identified as Mohamad Imran Mohd Nazir, while the second victim is Hani Suefyan Hanizam

    Also deployed are nine water rescue unit (PPDA) personnel, along with three fire trucks, one Emergency Medical Rescue Services (EMRS) van, and one boat, he added

    The search and rescue operation was also joined by 28 other members and personnel from the police, Civil Defence Force, Health Department, and the Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency (MMEA)

  • GERMANY FACES BACKLASH OVER REFUSAL TO GIVE UKRAINE TANKS

    https://www.channelnewsasia.com/world/ukraine-tanks-germany-leopard-russia-war-military-pistorius-podolyak-3222756

    01/21/2023

    78.57% Shortened!

    But German Defence Minister Boris Pistorius told reporters on the sidelines of the event at the US Ramstein Air Base that despite heightened expectations, "we still cannot say when a decision will be taken, and what the decision will be, when it comes to the Leopard tank"

    Several allies echoed Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in saying the tanks were essential to Ukraine's fight with its much larger neighbour

    In a joint statement - and a rare public criticism of Europe's top power - the foreign ministers of the three Baltic states said they "call on Germany to provide Leopard tanks to Ukraine now." "This is needed to stop Russian aggression, help Ukraine and restore peace in Europe quickly

    It is in your own national interest that (Russian President Vladimir) Putin loses in Ukraine," he said

    US officials said Ukraine still faced an uphill battle against Russian forces who still occupy one-fifth of the country 11 months after invading

    But they spoke of a possible campaign in the coming weeks by Ukraine to retake parts of its territory
